com.bluefire.bclreader.publicclasses

Class BCLHighlight

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bluefire.bclreader.publicclasses.BCLHighlight

  • public class BCLHighlight
extends java.lang.Object
    A BCLHighlight object represents a location within a book that renders as highlighted. A highlight is initially created by a BCLReaderView instance. If a highlight's location represents a range, the reader view will render the related text as highlighted. If the location does not represent a range, there will be no visible highlight.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BCLHighlight

        public BCLHighlight(java.lang.String highlightID,
                    BCLLocation location)
        Creates a highlight. A highlight is initially created by a BCLReaderView instance. An application may wish to save a reader view's highlights to local or remote storage. Then when a BCLReaderView instance is created at a later time, those highlights can be passed back in. This method exists to allow previously created highlights to be created again and passed to the reader view during initialization.
        Parameters:
        highlightID - The highlight ID.
        location - The location associated with the highlight.
